revised_title: DNA Replication in Eukaryotic Chromosomes: Insights from Autoradiography and Comparative Studies
tldr: The author discusses the evidence supporting the idea that each chromatid of a eukaryotic organism contains only one DNA double helix. They review various experiments, including autoradiography and DNA fibre autoradiography, which provide insights into the replication process and the structure of eukaryotic chromosomes.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Genetics and Molecular Biology
